title: How things turned sour so quickly for Unai Emery as Arsenal fans round on manager after Crystal Palace chaos
text:
It didn’t take a PhD in crowd psychology to see that the mood had turned at the Emirates this weekend. Arsenal fans made little effort to contain their fury as they watched their side blow a two-goal lead to draw 2-2 with Crystal Palace, a result which leaves them cut adrift from the top four in the Premier League.

While Granit Xhaka became the main target of their frustrations – not that he helped himself by attempting to orchestrate the boos which greeted him as he trudged off the pitch with exaggerated slowness, this after the announcement of his substitution was met with an ironic cheer – the spotlight has turned firmly on Unai Emery in the aftermath.

Xhaka may have cupped his ear at the fans, torn his shirt off and marched straight down the tunnel, but it is Emery who had to face the music afterwards and who will ultimately answer for the dire state the team is in.

Though Emery was keen to point to mitigating factors in his post-match presser – not least the late winner from Sokratis which was ruled out for an imperceptible foul from Calum Chambers in the build-up – Arsenal have only four wins from their first 10 games in the league and, for those who have been watching closely, the truth is that flatters them. It has been a dreadful start to the season, one which fits into a bigger picture of frustration and regression.
